title: A Blessing for the Bees — a New Year's prayer for 5786 by Devorah Brous (FromSoil2Soul)
author: Devorah Brous

coauthors.name: Devorah Brous
coauthors.bio: Devorah Brous (@Dev.Brous, she|her) is an urban homesteader and herbalist, ritual facilitator, and earth/soul-care consultant, "root down to rise up." She holds two Masters degrees in conflict resolution and development studies. A community organizer with systems-impacted and underinvested communities for 25 years (indigenous, houseless, and formerly incarcerated people), she is the former founding Executive Director of two mission-driven environmental nonprofits, BUSTAN, and Netiya. Her practice, FromSoil2Soul, is dedicated to tending people in time-tested earth-based traditions as well as emergent wellness exercises. Rooted in mystical Judaism and earth-based Torah, her nature-based healing practice is also grounded in soil science and the wise-woman tradition of folk herbalism woven together with poetry and prayer.

content:
Contribute a translation Source (English)
Source of Life,
bless the honeybees
for alchemizing apple blossoms
into fruit.
Bless the farmers,
the hive-tenders,
and the elements,
so the lands overflow
with abundant honeycomb.
Bless the bees,
that they may tumble
in pesticide-free meadow and food forest,
school garden and urban hive.
Bless their honey, pollen, and nectar
to feed worlds,
salve wounds,
and coat throats.
Our Sages teach
that honey sharpens the mind
and restores vision —
May the gifts of the honeybee inspire us
as harbingers of prophetic insight,
spooning honey generously
to soothe the anguish we carry, and we cause.
Bless the bees —
too often feared,
overworked,
and undermined.
May we revere pollinators
as bridge-builders —
for we are all interwoven.
Bless us
to cross-pollinate
the most equitable ideals
of our “hive mind,”
and offer honey to those pained
by swarm and sting.
Remind us
that bees guard what they treasure —
and so do we.
May we protect what we love
but break cycles of collapse,
and end the ravages of war.
Bless the bees that hum
while foraging and safeguarding
all that nourishes their hive.
Let us labor with love,
harvest only what we need,
and give back more than we take.
Guide us far
from extractive practices
until body and hive collapse.
May we value a sweet rest.
For hive collapse
is a whisper of war:
blossoms withering unvisited,
fruit orchards under rubble,
a ghastly hole in the web of life.
Landscapes made barren —
an erasure of what once was —
and a harrowing, urgent call
to tend what might become.
Tasting apples and honey in 5786,
may this ancient ritual touch lip and deed
as we repair one heart,
home, and hive
at a time.
Blessed are You,
the One who Regenerates,
for feeding the honeybees
so they can feed all of life,
and spread sweetness that heals.
Amen.

This prayer by Devorah Brous (fromsoil2soul), “A blessing for the bees (5786)” was first published as text rendered inside a video compiled by the author. For an earlier expression of this prayer, find “A blessing for the bees (5785)” (Devorah Brous, 2024).
